X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=494554680

David Pane,

> The big question is can any the state's directory content be
> deleted?

Yes you can delete any completed checkpoint without effecting the running
crawl except for your ability to restore the checkpoint.

> checkpoint contains around 42000 files.  The size of the checkpoint
> directories in the state directory vary (see sample below).  Can you
> explain why?

The du command does not count disk usage twice. If you du each checkpoint
directory on its own you may find that the total exceeds the capacity of the
disk because checkpoints use hard links to refer to shared resources.

You may also consider creating checkpoints at longer intervals to reduce the
need to manage them.

Travis
